isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - INSTALL - COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

svcprocinfo.para: Place the left countershaft assembly into position in the case, making sure that the "L"-marked assembly has the larger 47-tooth PTO gear ( Figure 381).

figure.caption: Figure 380. Place Left Countershaft Assembly into Position

svcprocinfo.para: Place the right countershaft assembly into position in the case, making sure that the "R"-marked assembly has the smaller 45-tooth PTO gear ( Figure 382).

figure.caption: Figure 381. Place Right Countershaft Assembly into Position

step1.para: Move the left countershaft assembly to the rear and insert the countershaft support tool or blocking to center the shaft in the rear case bore ( Figure 383).

figure.caption: Figure 382. Insert Countershaft Support Tool or Blocking

step1.para: Use a flanged end bearing driver to start the bearing in the case bore ( Figure 384).

figure.caption: Figure 383. Start Bearing in Case Bore

note.para: The inner race of the roller-type front bearing is pressed on the front of the countershaft.

step1.para: Center the front of the left countershaft in the bearing and move the assembly forward ( Figure 385).

figure.caption: Figure 384. Center Front of Left Countershaft in Bearing

step1.para: Use a flanged end bearing driver to completely seat the front bearing or bearing outer race in the case bore ( Figure 386).

figure.caption: Figure 385. Seat Front Bearing or Bearing Outer Race in Case Bore

step1.para: Position the retainer plate on the front of the left countershaft, roll pin in the hole at the end of the shaft, and secure with a bolt ( Figure 387). Tighten to 90 to 120 ft-lbs. (122 to 163 Nm).

figure.caption: Figure 386. Position Retainer Plate on Front of Left Countershaft

step1.para: Remove countershaft support tool or blocking from rear case bore and install the left countershaft rear bearing with the larger I.D. lead chamfer to the front of the shaft and install the snap ring in the groove at the rear of the left countershaft ( Figure 388).

figure.caption: Figure 387. Install Left Countershaft Rear Bearing
